org.qbroker.sonicmq

Class SonicMQRequester

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.sonicmq.SonicMQRequester
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<com.sonicsw.mf.common.metrics.IMetric>, Connector, Requester
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SonicMQMessenger

    public class SonicMQRequester
extends java.lang.Object
implements Requester, java.util.Comparator<com.sonicsw.mf.common.metrics.IMetric>
    SonicMQRequester connects to a SonicMQ broker for JMX requests. Currently, it supports the method of list, query, browse on durable subscriptions, addListener and removeListener.

    Since ObjectName does not allow any key containing the char of ':', the replacement of ':' to '.' on subscription_id is assumed for queries as a workaround. It means you have to replace ':' with '.' in the query if the subscription_id is specified and it contains ':'.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

      • getResponse

        public int getResponse(java.lang.String jmxCmd,
              java.lang.StringBuffer strBuf,
              boolean autoDisconn)
                throws WrapperException
        This takes a JMX query command and converts it into a JMX request. It sends the request to the destination and returns the number of items filled in the given string buffer. The content in the string buffer is a JSON. If the disconnect flag is set to true, it disconnects right before it returns. Otherwise, it will keep the connection.

        The JMX command is supposed to be as follows:
        DISPLAY Target attr0:attr1:attr2

        In case of a fatal failure, it disconnects first and then throws a WrapperException with cause set to the vendor specific exception or IO related exception. Therefore please make sure to get the cause exception from it and handles the cause exception with care. For other failures, it throws an IllegalArgumentException. If the disconnect flag is set to true, it disconnects right before it throws the exception.
        Specified by:
        getResponse in interface Requester
        Throws:
        WrapperException
